title.narrative: EDUCATION SYSTEM

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2021, children and adolescents at greater disadvantage, mainly those affected by violence, forced displacement and migration, have access to safe, inclusive, flexible and innovative forms of quality education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: In 2021, the education system prepared a virtual platform through the innovative "Learning Passport" strategy, in preparation to reopen schools. The platform already registers more than 14,000 students and 90,000 more were reached through digital learning content. Additionally, 40 schools affected by hurricanes Eta and Iota were rehabilitated. With support from UNICEF advocacy and international cooperation, the Ministry of Education officially authorized the reopening of 131 urban schools in 2021, benefiting 17,388 children and adolescents through blended learning modalities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/01/2022
